course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Introduction to Smart Electric Power Systems
course.description: This is an introductory course for electric power systems and smart grid. The course includes the following topics: power concepts for ac systems, generation, transmission, distribution, and utilization of electric power, system aspects of synchronous machines, transmission lines, transformers, and motors. Power flow and contingency states. Smart grid concepts, role of information technology in smart grid applications, smart metering, smart buildings and homes.
course.prerequisites: ELEC 1100 OR PHYS 1114 OR PHYS 1314

reviews.author: 我愛樓主
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction
Power Industry History & Review of Phasors
Complex power, three-phase
Per phase and per unit system
Transformers
Synchronous machines
Transmission lines
======Content covered in Midterm======

Induction motors
Power flow analysis
Economic dispatch
Electricity market
Blackout, contingency and protection
Distribution system
Smart grids
======Content covered in Final======

Content in final exam would not include the content covered in midterm exam.

Make sure you have basic knowledge about ac circuit before studying this course. For example, you need to familiar with conversion of rectangle form and polar form.

Maths skill in this course is needed, such as
$ Complex number
$ Matrix multiplication
$ Solving system of linear equations
$ Numerical analysis
-- Fixed-point Method
-- Newton-Raphson Method
$ Lagrange multiplier
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teaching, the professor goes over the concepts clearly.

As with most ELEC courses, the TAs are amazing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (x 4) 20%
Midterm Exam 40%
Final Exam 40%
The mean is about B.I got slightly above mean that get a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Zero workload

Although HW was quite hard, TA would teach you to step by step.
